title: Nominate a ‘Woman of Impact’ who's bringing bold visions to life
text:
Lauren Simmons was one of our 2018 honorees. She's the youngest female trader at the New York Stock Exchange. | Richard Drew/AP Photo Women Rule Nominate a ‘Woman of Impact’ who's bringing bold visions to life

Nominations for the 2019 class of Women Rule “Women of Impact" are now open. Past honorees have included civil rights activist Tarana Burke, Lauren Simmons, the youngest female trader on the New York Stock Exchange, and Rep. Ilhan Omar (D-Minn.), after her historic election.

We want to hear from you about the women who are on the front lines, moving the needle in their respective fields. We want you to nominate women who are bringing their bold visions to life, whether they're running for office, leading a business or championing a cause. We’ll honor these women at the Women Rule summit in December in Washington.

Story Continued Below

While there are more women in positions of power than perhaps ever before, these women are believers and doers. They are leaders with conviction who are also doing the work in the trenches. Tell us about a standout woman we should honor at this year’s summit. The summit will feature a full day of empowering conversations, networking and real talk about what it will take for women to break through.

Women Rule is a community of influential women devoted to expanding leadership opportunities for other women. Women Rule is produced by POLITICO in partnership with our founding partners, Google and the Tory Burch Foundation.





This form requires JavaScript to complete. Powered by Screendoor.
description: Whether she’s running for office, leading a business or championing a cause, tell us about about a standout woman we should honor at our Women Rule summit.
